psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 51,3]]Have mercy on me, O God, in your goodness; 
in the greatness of your compassion wipe out my offense.
[[Ps 51,4]]Thoroughly wash me from my guilt 
and of my sin cleanse me.

[[Ps 51,5]]For I acknowledge my offense, 
and my sin is before me always:
[[Ps 51,6a]]"Against you only have I sinned,
[[Ps 51,6b]]and done what is evil in your sight."

[[Ps 51,6c]]That you may be justified in your sentence,
vindicated when you condemn.
[[Ps 51,7]]Indeed, in guilt was I born,
and in sin my mother conceived me.

[[Ps 51,12]]A clean heart create for me, O God, 
and a steadfast spirit renew within me.
[[Ps 51,13]]Cast me not out from your presence, 
and your Holy Spirit take not from me.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 14,22]]After he had fed the people, Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and precede him to the other side of the sea, while he dismissed the crowds.
[[Mt 14,23]]After doing so, he went up on the mountain by himself to pray. When it was evening he was there alone.
[[Mt 14,24]]Meanwhile the boat, already a few miles offshore, was being tossed about by the waves, for the wind was against it.
[[Mt 14,25]]During the fourth watch of the night, he came toward them, walking on the sea.
[[Mt 14,26]]When the disciples saw him walking on the sea they were terrified. "It is a ghost," they said, and they cried out in fear.
[[Mt 14,27]]At once (Jesus) spoke to them, "Take courage, it is I; do not be afraid."
[[Mt 14,28]]Peter said to him in reply, "Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the water."
[[Mt 14,29]]He said, "Come." Peter got out of the boat and began to walk on the water toward Jesus.
[[Mt 14,30]]But when he saw how (strong) the wind was he became frightened; and, beginning to sink, he cried out, "Lord, save me!"
[[Mt 14,31]]Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand and caught him, and said to him, "O you of little faith, why did you doubt?"
[[Mt 14,32]]After they got into the boat, the wind died down.
[[Mt 14,33]]Those who were in the boat did him homage, saying, "Truly, you are the Son of God."
[[Mt 14,34]]After making the crossing, they came to land at Gennesaret.
[[Mt 14,35]]When the men of that place recognized him, they sent word to all the surrounding country. People brought to him all those who were sick
[[Mt 14,36]]and begged him that they might touch only the tassel on his cloak, and as many as touched it were healed.

first_reading.title: Book of Numbers
first_reading.text:
[[Nb 12,1]]Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses on the pretext of the marriage he had contracted with a Cushite woman.
[[Nb 12,2]]They complained, "Is it through Moses alone that the LORD speaks? Does he not speak through us also?" And the LORD heard this.
[[Nb 12,3]]Now, Moses himself was by far the meekest man on the face of the earth.
[[Nb 12,4]]So at once the LORD said to Moses and Aaron and Miriam, "Come out, you three, to the meeting tent." And the three of them went.
[[Nb 12,5]]Then the LORD came down in the column of cloud, and standing at the entrance of the tent, called Aaron and Miriam. When both came forward,
[[Nb 12,6]]he said, "Now listen to the words of the LORD: Should there be a prophet among you, in visions will I reveal myself to him, in dreams will I speak to him;
[[Nb 12,7]]Not so with my servant Moses! Throughout my house he bears my trust:
[[Nb 12,8]]face to face I speak to him, plainly and not in riddles. The presence of the LORD he beholds. Why, then, did you not fear to speak against my servant Moses?"
[[Nb 12,9]]So angry was the LORD against them that when he departed,
[[Nb 12,10]]and the cloud withdrew from the tent, there was Miriam, a snow-white leper! When Aaron turned and saw her a leper,
[[Nb 12,11]]"Ah, my lord!" he said to Moses, "please do not charge us with the sin that we have foolishly committed!
[[Nb 12,12]]Let her not thus be like the stillborn babe that comes forth from its mother's womb with its flesh half consumed."
[[Nb 12,13]]Then Moses cried to the LORD, "Please, not this! Pray, heal her!"
